org.digijava.kernel.util

Class UserUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digijava.kernel.util.UserUtils

  • public class UserUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class containts user-related utillity functions. User must be always identified by User object

      • getUserPreferences

        public static UserPreferences getUserPreferences(User user,
                                                 Site site)
                                          throws DgException
        Returns user preferences for particular site. null, if there are no preferences defined for this user and site
        Parameters:
        user - User, for which preferences are defined
        site - Site, which is the owner of user preferences
        Returns:
        UserPreferences
        Throws:
        DgException - if error occurs.

        public static java.lang.String getUserImageUrl(User user,
                                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Returns URL of user's photo to be displayed on the current site. The current site (and its domain) is determined from the request. Returns null if the current user does not have image
        Parameters:
        user - User
        request - HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        String

      • fillUserSubject

        public static javax.security.auth.Subject fillUserSubject(javax.security.auth.Subject subject,
                                                          User user)
        Fills given subject with user's information and returns it. If subject is null, new instance is created
        Parameters:
        subject - Subject user's subject
        user - User
        Returns:
        Subject, filled with user's information

      • setPassword

        public static void setPassword(User user,
                               java.lang.String password)
        Put new password in user object. This method does not perform any database modifications. It simply puts new password and salt in object's fields
        Parameters:
        user - User
        password - String new password
